title: How to cite a book with multiple authors - Quora

response.answer_text: How do I cite a source with multiple authors in MLA style (in-text)? Sources with two authors List the authors' last names in the sentence and put the page number in parentheses at the end. For example: Russell and Winterbottom state in their introduction that .... (11). The authors state that ... (Russell and Winterbottom 11). Corresponding Works Cited entry: Russell, D. A., and Michael Winterbottom. Classical Literary Criticism. Oxford UP, 2008. Sources with three or more authors For works with three or more authors, include the last name of the first author followed by et al Marscot et al. discuss the ... (29). The authors disagree with a hypothesis proposed by .... (Marscot et al. 14). Corresponding Works Cited entry: Marscot, Michel et al. Applied Social Sciences. Cambridge Scholars Publishing, 2013. If you’re using a style guide other than MLA, look it up. It’s probably very similar.

Using APA, in-text citations for a book would be the same as for other sources, e.g., author1 and author2 (year). Note that APA has specific rules for how many authors should be mentioned, and when - as well as the use of “et al.”. See In-Text Citations: The Basics // Purdue Writing Lab However, the associated APA reference for a book will differ from other sources. See Reference List: Books // Purdue Writing Lab
